item.title: Visual Aftereffects From Sequential Principal Curves
item.description: Table of Contents Visual AfterEffects Why do we have these illusions? Predictions using Sequential Principal Curves Analysis Conclusion Data Code Visual AfterEffects (animated examples) Aftereffects are visual illusions occurring when the sensory system is put into a particular operation regime driven by the environment (e.g. after prolonged exposure to specific moving patterns).
